App.FlashbackWithoutAudio: Video flashback will run without audio until permissions are granted.

AutoDetectInfoModal.Title: Auto-Detect Meetings
AutoDetectInfoModal.Subtitle: Never Miss a Meeting Again
AutoDetectInfoModal.Description: Auto-Detect automatically starts recording when you join meetings, so you never forget to press record.
AutoDetectInfoModal.Step1Desc: Turn on the toggle and select which apps to monitor
AutoDetectInfoModal.Step2Desc: Open Zoom, Teams, Meet, or any supported app
AutoDetectInfoModal.Tip1Desc: Set "Always Record" for work meetings, "Ask Every Time" for personal calls
AutoDetectInfoModal.Tip2Desc: Uses microphone activity, window titles, and browser URLs for accuracy

AutoRecording.Title: Auto Detect Meetings
AutoRecording.BugReport: See a bug? Report it to seameet@seasalt.ai
AutoRecording.HelpWanted: If you'd like to request a new app added, or you have verified an app working, please let us know at seameet@seasalt.ai. We appreciate your help to make this app better!

BlackHole.InstallInstructions: To record system audio on macOS, you need to install BlackHole virtual audio driver:
BlackHole.SetupStep1: Open Audio MIDI Setup (Applications â†’ Utilities)
BlackHole.SetupStep4: Right-click the Multi-Output and select 'Use This Device For Sound Output'
BlackHole.SetupStep5: Reboot if BlackHole doesn't appear in the device list
BlackHole.SetupStep6: Select 'BlackHole 2ch' as your audio source in this app

BluetoothWarningToast.Title: âš ï¸ Bluetooth Microphone Detected
BluetoothWarningToast.Description: Your OS may force your audio to "Communications Mode" when using Bluetooth microphones, which can cause audio distortion or loudness issues during recording.
BluetoothWarningToast.Recommendation: Switch to a non-Bluetooth microphone (like your built-in mic or a USB microphone) for better recording quality.

DeletePrompt.Title: Delete file
DeletePrompt.Message: Are you sure you want to delete this file? This action cannot be undone.

Events.Title: Events
Events.EmptyWhileRecording: No events yet. Click 'Mark' while recording to add one.
Events.EmptyWhenNotRecording: No events available for this recording.

DeletePrompt.Title: Delete event
DeletePrompt.Message: Are you sure you want to delete this event? This action cannot be undone.

FlashbackControls.Label: FLASHBACK
FlashbackControls.CannotChangeWhileRecording: Cannot change flashback mode while recording

FlashbackInfoModal.Title: Flashback Recording
FlashbackInfoModal.Subtitle: Your Personal Time Machine
FlashbackInfoModal.SubtitleDesc: Never miss an important moment againâ€”capture up to 2 minutes from the past, even after it happened.

Audio.Title: Audio Flashback
Audio.BestFor: Recording meetings, phone calls, voice conversations

Video.Title: Video Flashback
Video.BestFor: Presentations, gaming highlights, screen sharing sessions, visual content

Step1.Title: Enable Flashback
Step1.Desc: Click FLASHBACK button to turn on. Buffer starts filling automatically.

Step2.Title: Wait for Ready
Step2.Desc: Watch for green status. Buffer must fill to 90% before you can capture past.

Step3.Title: Press Record
Step3.Desc: When something important happens, press Record. Flashback grabs the buffer and continues recording forward.

OhNo.Title: The "Oh no!" Moment
OhNo.Desc: Colleague says something profound. You realize you want to record it. Press Record â†’ Flashback captures the last 30 seconds (including that moment!).

Gaming.Title: Gaming Highlight
Gaming.Desc: Pull off an incredible combo. Press Record immediately. Flashback captures gameplay leading up to that combo + your reaction.

Decision.Title: Important Decision
Decision.Desc: Lawyer explains contract clause. Press Record to capture explanation. Have a complete, accurate record to review later.

AudioDaily.Title: Audio Flashback for Daily Use
AudioDaily.Desc: Use 30-second Audio Flashback for meetings and calls. Low memory usage, works reliably.

VideoSpecial.Title: Video Flashback for Special Moments
VideoSpecial.Desc: Enable Video Flashback (30s buffer) for presentations, gaming highlights, or any visual content you want to preserve.

Memory.Title: Memory Management
Memory.Desc: With 2 minutes of video flashback: entire application takes less than1GB of RAM.

FlashbackSettingsDetail.BufferDurationDesc: How long to keep audio/video buffered

FloatingStartBar.BluetoothMicDesc: Your OS may force "Communications Mode" which can cause distortion.
FloatingStartBar.BluetoothMicTipText: Use a non-Bluetooth microphone for better quality.
FloatingStartBar.FailedToLoadScreens: Failed to load screens. Please try again.
FloatingStartBar.FailedToLoadWindows: Failed to load windows. Please try again.
FloatingStartBar.NoWindowsDetected: No windows detected. Open an app window and refresh.
FloatingStartBar.ScreenNotAvailable: Screen selection is not available on this platform.
FloatingStartBar.WindowNotAvailable: Window selection is not available on this platform.

FullscreenOverlay.ClickToRecord: Click Start Recording in the floating bar to record the selected region

JumpList.RecordRegionDesc: Select a screen region to record
JumpList.TakeScreenshotDesc: Capture a region of the screen

MeetingPrompt.StartMessage: Are you having a meeting on {{appName}}? Do you need me to record the meeting right now?
MeetingPrompt.BrowserHint: ðŸ’¡ Tip: For browser meetings (Google Meet, Zoom, Teams), I can only detect the browser, not the specific website.
MeetingPrompt.RememberChoice: Remember my choice and don't prompt again
MeetingPrompt.EndMessage: I detected meeting on {{appName}} just ended. Would you like me to stop recording?

Permissions.AutoRecordNextTime: Do you want to auto record this app next time?
Permissions.AutoRecordReason: {{app}} is set to Always Auto Record. Change the app record permission in Settings -> Auto Record.
Permissions.GuidanceAlways: : SeaMeet will auto record without asking for confirmation
Permissions.GuidanceAsk: : SeaMeet will ask for your permission to record every time
Permissions.GuidanceNever: : SeaMeet will not prompt to record
Permissions.AutoStartAudioRule: If Default Recording Mode is Audio, SeaMeet starts recording immediately without asking.
Permissions.AutoStartFullscreenRule: If Default Recording Mode is Fullscreen and only one screen is connected, SeaMeet starts recording immediately.
Permissions.AutoStartFallbackRule: In all other cases, SeaMeet will show the recording mode selector so you can choose.

RingMenu.FlashbackNotCharged: Flashback not charged, click once to charge audio flashback, double click to charge screen flashback
RingMenu.FlashbackSaveTooltip: Single click to save the last {{duration}}s {{mode}} flashback. Double click to continue recording from here.

ScreenPicker.Title: Select a display
ScreenPicker.Instruction: Choose which display to record for fullscreen recordings.

ScreenshotViewer.CopyFailed: Failed to copy screenshot to clipboard
ScreenshotViewer.ShareFailed: Sharing not supported on this browser. Open screenshot manually to share.
ScreenshotViewer.ShareNotSupported: Native sharing not supported on this platform. Use Copy to clipboard instead.

Settings.Title: Settings

Terms.OneSentenceSummary: SeaMeet is a free, privacyâ€‘first recorder where local use requires no account, your data stays yours, cloud features are optional, and you must get consent before recording.
Terms.TLDRTitle: SeaMeet Terms â€” TLDR for Busy Humans
TLDRItems: SeaMeet Desktop is free â€” all nonâ€‘AI features work without an account or login.
Get consent before recording â€” SeaMeet doesn't check this for you.
Your recordings and transcripts are yours; SeaMeet only processes them to run as service.
Cloud features require an account and store data on SeaMeet servers.
Anonymous diagnostics are optional and can be turned off anytime.
Don't misuse of app (no illegal use, no hacking).
Service may change, and liability is limited.

Privacy.OneSentenceSummary: SeaMeet Desktop keeps all recordings on your device fully local and private, and requires no account. Cloud features are optional, encrypted, and fully under your control.
Privacy.TLDRTitle: SeaMeet Privacy â€” TLDR for Busy Humans
TLDRItems: SeaMeet Desktop is private by design: everything stays on your device; we don't collect audio, video, screen content, or meeting data.
No account needed to use desktop app's nonâ€‘AI features.
Anonymous diagnostics are optional â€” off by default, and never include recordings or personal content.
SeaMeet Cloud is optional: only if you choose to upload or record via cloud do we process audio, transcripts, and meeting metadata.
Cloud accounts store basic info (name, email) and usage data for security and service quality.
Thirdâ€‘party integrations are optional and fully revocable.
We don't sell data, and cloud recordings are encrypted.
You control your data â€” delete recordings anytime or request full deletion.

MicrophoneActivity.Title: Microphone Activity Only
MicrophoneActivity.Description: Auto-detect monitors your microphone use to infer which app uses it. No data is captured.

NoDataAccess.Title: No Data Access
NoDataAccess.Description: Auto-detect only detects whether microphone is used or not. It does NOT access any recorded data.

ExplicitApproval.Title: Explicit Approval Required
ExplicitApproval.Description: Auto-detect will NEVER start a recording automatically without your explicit approval.

NoDataCollection.Title: No Data Collection
NoDataCollection.Description: SeaMeet does not collect ANY data from auto-detect feature without your consent.

LocalOnly.Title: 100% Local
LocalOnly.Description: Flashback runs entirely on your local machine. Nothing is synced to the cloud.

RAMOnly.Title: RAM Only
RAMOnly.Description: All data stays in memory. Nothing is written to disk unless you save a Flashback recording.

Protected.Title: Protected
Protected.Description: Your privacy and security are paramount. Your data never leaves your device.

EthicalUse.Title: Ethical Use
EthicalUse.Description: Always inform and obtain consent from others before using Flashback to record them.

Storage.Title: Storage Settings
Storage.Description: Choose the default folder SeaMeet uses when automatically saving recordings.

Settings.SettingsFileDescription: Settings are stored in a single JSON file for easy backup and management

Item.ImproveTranslationHint: Help improve this translation on GitHub â†’

AppPermissions.Title: App Permissions
AppPermissions.Description: Manage which apps can auto-record when detected using your microphone.
AppPermissions.EmptyState: No apps detected yet. When SeaMeet detects an app using your microphone, it will appear here.
AppPermissions.DeleteTooltip: Remove from list (resets to 'Ask Every Time')

Shortcuts.ConflictWarning: This shortcut is already used by another app and can't be registered.

Tray.MinimizedHint: SeaMeet is still running in the system tray (bottom-right).

UpdateQuitModal.Title: Update Available
UpdateQuitModal.InstallBeforeQuitting: Would you like to install it before quitting?

HelpSupportSection.WikiDesc: Check out the SeaMeet wiki for documentation and guides.
HelpSupportSection.IssuesDesc: Report bugs and request features (requires GitHub account).
HelpSupportSection.DiscussionDesc: Join the community discussion (requires GitHub account).
HelpSupportSection.EmailDesc: Reach out to our team directly.
HelpSupportSection.DogfoodingDesc: We encourage you to use SeaMeet to record an issue and post it in either Issues or Email us!
HelpSupportSection.ImproveTranslationDesc: Help us improve translations or request a new language on GitHub.

VideoSettings.Title: Video Recording Settings
VideoSettings.RegionInfo: You will be prompted to select a screen or window when recording starts.
VideoSettings.HideWindow: Hide SeaMeet window when selecting region
VideoSettings.FlashbackArmedNotice: You are recording with {{seconds}}s of flashback buffer

CodecTooltip.VP9: This recording uses VP9 for best quality. Some default video players â€” such as Windows Media Player and QuickTime on macOS â€” may not support this format. For reliable playback, please use a modern browser (Chrome or Edge) or a compatible player like VLC.
CodecTooltip.VP8: This recording uses VP8 for best quality. Some default video players â€” such as Windows Media Player and QuickTime on macOS â€” may not support this format. For reliable playback, please use a modern browser (Chrome or Edge) or a compatible player like VLC.

WindowPicker.Title: Select a window
WindowPicker.Instruction: Choose a window to capture for window recordings.
WindowPicker.None: No windows detected. Open an application and refresh.

Common.AppSubtitle: Record device input and output audio
Common.FileNameCopiedWithRenameHint: {{fileName}} copied to clipboard. Double click to change file name.

RecordingsList.NoRecordings: No recordings yet. Start recording to see them here.

FileImport.DragDropFiles: Drag and drop your audio, video, and image files here
FileImport.DragDropSubtitle: Drag and drop audio, video, and image files here
FileImport.SupportedFormats: Supported: MP3, WAV, M4A, WebM, OGG, PNG, JPG, and more
FileImport.VideoImportStart: You imported a video file, SeaMeet will now extract its audio track.

AudioControls.MicrophoneGainWarning: High microphone gain can pick up speaker playback even when "System Audio" is off. Use headphones or lower microphone gain for mic-only recordings.

FlashbackHeroUI.DescNone: Record your screen, audio, or take a screenshot. Choose a flashback mode above to enable moment saving.
FlashbackHeroUI.DescInit: Click 'Ready?' to tell SeaMeet to start 'remembering' the past.
FlashbackHeroUI.DescCharging: Priming your {{duration}}-second window... almost ready to catch what you might miss. {{progress}}% complete.
FlashbackHeroUI.DescReady: Flashback is armed. Whenever you hit Record, the past {{duration}} seconds of {{type}} is included â€” never regret a missed moment again.
FlashbackHeroUI.PrivacyDesc: SeaMeet snapshots the past {{duration}}s of {{type}} in a ring buffer locally on your computer's RAM.
FlashbackHeroUI.FlashbackOff: Flashback is currently off. Start a normal recording anytime, or choose a flashback mode (audio or screen) above to enable heroic moment saving.
FlashbackHeroUI.FlashbackInitDescription: Click 'Ready?' to tell SeaMeet to start 'remembering' the past.
FlashbackHeroUI.FlashbackReadyDescription: Flashback is armed. The past {{seconds}}s of {{type}} is included when you record.
FlashbackHeroUI.FlashbackPrivacy: Your privacy is protected. Stored locally in RAM.
FlashbackHeroUI.KeepWindowVisible: Keep SeaMeet window visible when taking screenshot
FlashbackHeroUI.FlashbackMismatch: Flashback mode mismatch. Audio recording but video flashback is active. Please disable video flashback.
